title: Can this be reversed, I feel this is wrong
body: So yesterday i played a game with a troll, and from the start people called him a troll for going teemo bot lane. Which he stood in lane went invis and did nothing. Its a bit tilting after he inted 3 kills and fed botlane not even 10-12 mins in. In this time i had my entire team sit there and say i was feeding but had yet to die, playing pyke support. In this game i was called a r%%%%%(which i have disabilities so i dont take too kindly to it) and i shot back with a few things, then after repeatedly being told i suck weiner and trying to counter the flame that was coming my way eventually gave in to the full tilt and tried to make light of the situation and defend myself. I had a teammate say i said the N word and he all chatted for the other team to report me as well. My other teammates chimed in as well. So after my whole team flaming me and i understand what i say is my own actions and could have muted them but its more upsetting i received a perma ban for this. Yet the people that flamed me first and all get to still play after the offensive language used. Now mind you i tried to defend this teemo giving him the benefit of the doubt. I received 2 tilt proof honors and a gg, but yet the adc reported me for unsportsman like conduct. I feel riot has made a mistake. I know most perma bans dont get overturned, but i had been playing alot to try and get my honor level back up and not be ome of the toxic people in this game cause leta be honest its not fun to play a game where people talk trash constantly, it reminded me of a mw2 lobby, if most of you played console games back then.

replies.body:
>...and i shot back with a few things

This is the problem. The mute button exists to avoid toxic behavior like that you were exposed to. Use it. When you retaliate with rule-breaking behavior that just means that now MORE people are breaking the rules.

Each player involved will have their behavior reviewed (if reported) based on their previous behavior and their previous punishments. In your case what I imagine is a previous 14-day ban resulted in this punishment triggering a permanent ban. The other players may not have been at that point yet, so their punishments may be different and/or lesser as a result of their punishment history.

I have a hard time muting people as thats where some of the communication comes from, if you mute everyone your on your own and thats where it becomes harder cause there is no teamwork. You cant sit there and be like mid come down for a gank, or tell your adc to focus the less fed support or anything. Thats where muting is more of a problem except when peope are super toxic. Ive played a lot of ranked and thats all i do, im not the best, but i dont like to lose. Ive played with extremely toxic people, and still communicated to win the game. I feel the report system needs a revamp and a little more guudelines, most of my insults were about me being 4-0 and a mid laner being 1-7.. you cant even sit there and competitive bs anymore cause everyone is offended by everything.

If im wrong well then gg riot for the 975$ ive put into this game over the past year and a half and gg to putting time and effort into a game where you cant even say anything to anyone without someone being offended.

You can be competitive without insulting others or mocking them for a bad score. You can communicate with others and even defend yourself against their accusations or their toxic behavior without resorting to toxic behavior yourself. If you wish to leave communication open in the knowledge that you are going to experience toxic behavior, that is your choice, but it does not absolve you of responsibility for letting their words get to you and you choosing to retaliate using toxic behavior. The choice is always yours.
Insulting players for playing poorly isn't competitive bs, it's toxic.
he insulted me i neber bashed him for being 1-7 other then look at your own score before you judge mine?
And that is insulting - him doing it first does not make it okay for you to do so back.
I dont see how that is insulting by any means, but hey everyone is offended by everything nowadays, dont judge one if you cant judge yourself.
Pointing out someone’s performance and saying, in effect, “you can’t talk because you suck”? You don’t see how that’s insulting?

No him pointing out that im doing bad when hes saying im doing bad hes contradocting himself... so its okay for him to say it buy when i point out hey youre 1-7 why are youbsaying im doing bad when im trying to do my best? Guess thats hpw league works..

Where have I said “its okay for him to say it”? I have not said that at all. It is not okay for **either of you** to break the rules. It doesn’t matter who “started it”.

This is about **your** punishment, which is based on **your** behavior. Someone else’s behavior does not make yours more or less acceptable.

Change your in-client Summoner Icon. If you're talking about the purple star specifically, it's a special icon we give to members of the Moderation team to help identify them.

You retaliated with insults... thats not defense. Defending yourself would involve correcting them about who you are. Self defense is about you, not finding faults in other people. I mean, its not a physical fight, its text. You remove the threat, and in this case, insulting someone isnt removing the threat, muting is. So dont give us that defend yourself shit. You retaliated... you countered. You did what they did to you, and thats against the rules. You can defend yourself, but you cant insult other players. Mute, report, move on. And im just going off your own description. If im wrong, feel free to post the chat logs.

"trying to counter the flame that was coming my way eventually gave in to the full tilt and tried to make light of the situation and defend myself"

Oof.

"i understand what i say is my own actions and could have muted them"

Yep.

"I dont see how that is insulting by any means, but hey everyone is offended by everything nowadays"

That lack of personal growth is why your ban is permanent. Riot realized you'll never take responsibility for your actions and clean up your behavior in game.

I have though. I try and encourage people to do better in game and even give tips, but still sometimes you get a group of people that you cant handle and are completely toxic, i dont feel like it was insulting i was in self defense after being attacked, i dont just be like dude why do you suck... thats ignorant but its not gonna get lifted.

You are certainly allowed to defend yourself from toxic chat, which is accomplished by muting. This is a 100% effective method. Flaming back is a 0% effective method that also constitutes unacceptable behavior and thus opens you up to reports and punishments. Read about this in more detail [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/Pqc6PJUE-players-who-flame-back-in-self-defense-dont-understand-the-meaning-of-those-words).
